title: Bugfix: Hull polygons weren't tagged as sanitized

issue.title: linear_extrude() hull() {...} causes assertion failure in linear_extrude.cc / core dump
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Doing `linear_extrude` on a `hull` causes assertion failure in linear_extrude.cc and core dump.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create .scad file with content `linear_extrude(10) hull() square(10);`, lets name it `linear_extrude_bug.scad`
2. Execute `openscad linear_extrude_bug.scad`
3. Observe openscad crash with error message

**Expected behavior**
Expect OpenSCAD to start cleanly and either render the contents of the scad file or if there is a syntax or other error in the .scad file, display it with the render messages as it should.

**Code reproducing the issue**
```
linear_extrude(10) hull() square(10);
```

**Screenshots**
```
bivanbi@eenovo:/tmp$ openscad --version
OpenSCAD version 2024.12.29
bivanbi@eenovo:/tmp$ cat openscad_linear_extrude_bug.scad 
linear_extrude(10) hull() square(10);
bivanbi@eenovo:/tmp$ openscad openscad_linear_extrude_bug.scad
Warning: Ignoring XDG_SESSION_TYPE=wayland on Gnome. Use QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland to run on Wayland anyway.
openscad: /opt/openscad/src/geometry/linear_extrude.cc:409: std::unique_ptr<Geometry> extrudePolygon(const LinearExtrudeNode&, const Polygon2d&): Assertion `poly.isSanitized()' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
```

**Environment and Version info (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS
 - System: Intel PC 64-bit
 - OpenSCAD Version: 2024.12.29 (github master branch, commit hash: `5cb4ccfc1bc5955cbdb8bf7556423ba91462c108`)
